text: I'm vegan and pretty much get the same dishes every time. So much so that the waitress who recognizes me says I eat like a Chinese person, which I take as a total compliment! Try the Chinese broccoli in garlic sauce. Ask them to make it spicy if you like a little more heat. Try the fried tofu or string beans as an appetizer. They're both delish! The mixed mushroom and tofu is really yummy, sauce is awesome and the variety of mushrooms will satisfy you when you need a "meaty" texture. Service is attentive, the dining room is quite lovely with ancient artwork all around and they have a full bar. I love this place!

We have tried no less than 5 restaurants at the "newer" Chinatown "mall" but were disappointed time after time... from flavorless food to horrible service;  always something but NEVER great dishes. So today we ventured across the street to the original strip and went into 3 places but none seemed to be using a wok. Noodle joints,  bbq 'advertised' joint, and then took the yelp 4 star recommended EMPEROR's CHOICE RESTAURANT for our newest dining experience. Glad we did,  FANTASTIC FRIENDLY SERVICE (we left a BIG tip for that pleasure) plus the BEST food yet in CHINATOWN! We had 2 dishes; Triple delight with broad noodle (N4, DRY CANTONESE CHOW FUN) fresh from the wok was great! Tender beef, perfect shrimp, and large pieces of chicken.  PORK Egg Foo Young equally as good with tender chunks of pork and thickened beef gravy!   The EFY was NOT OILY either.   We WILL be back... no upcharge for crispy noodle, tea, OR rice. You are now our new 'go to' place in CHINATOWN!   ATTENTION TOURISTS & RESIDENTS:  From downtown we always take the water taxi (senior discount daily pass only $6) and the ride home AT DUSK is spectacular! Always enjoying Chicago's skyline day or night!

Had dinner here last night. Ordered 2 lobsters at $38.50 each. Mushroom/tofu dish. Sweet & sour chicken. Roasted duck. Yang Chow fried rice. We were served 1 dead lobster mixed with a live one. We told the manager about their trickery and at first, he denied it. In our receipt, we were given a 10% discount.   They should not have served us a dead lobster at all! Don't go to this restaurant, it will be guessing game for your hard-earned money! We did not leave any tip. We paid our bill $140 and left. Very

YES best chinese take out in chicago at a fairly reasonable price! I'm so happy I found this place because honestly I was so disappointed with the chinese food in this city!  I always always get the beef and broccoli here- the meat is SO TENDER. I've gotten this dish at other take out places like (cough yu choy and chi cafe) and it was so tough and the sauce was weirdly sour!! definitely definitely get this dish here. the sauce here is so good- probably the best beef and broccoli sauce I've had- not too salty but not too bland, not too thick but not too watery- just REALLY good.  The shrimp ho fun here is my other go to! LOTS of veggies and noodles and shrimp! sometimes I find that restaurants skimp on the shrimp so I have a habit of picking at the veggies and noodles and saving the shrimp- however, the dish from here had SO MANY SHRIMPIES I was so happy and was able to have a shrimp piece for almost every bite of noodle.  The general tso's chicken here is also really really good- nice thick batter coating a juicy chicken piece. DELICIOUS sweet/sour/spicy sauce coating the crunchy batter exterior of the chicken YUM YUM YUM. I would say this place has a better general tso chicken than lao sze chuan (and I think it's also slightly cheaper! win win)  The chicken lo mein was also very good and they are very very generous with the chicken pieces! I almost wanted more veggies in it because there were SO MANY chicken pieces (which i think is always a good thing) and again, the chicken was very tender and not tough (which can be an issue sometimes with this dish)  Overall, very very yummy place. I hope more people discover this place and give them more reviews and business because they deserve it!!!  (also, along with fortune cookies they give you these sweet biscuits- if you've been to ming hin, it's essentially the same biscuits they give out there- which are also a delicious treat to end your meal with!)

Although I was born & raised in Chicago, I haven't eaten here in over 20 years, I have too many friends that own restaurants in Chinatown that are my usual stops. A friend mentioned that Emperor's Choice had changed hands & the food was very good, so we dined there tonight. The food was excellent, we only ordered the authentic Chinese dishes & found it to genuine & high quality. The one thing that sets this restaurant  above others in Chinatown, serving similar dishes is; They have clean washrooms. Well worth a visit!

I Ordered delivery because it had good reviews, so you can imagine how disappointed I was when I received my food and was inedible. I ordered salt and pepper calamari, crab ragoons, Mongolian beef and Hunan chicken. The calamari had a good flavor but the texture was off for squid. The crab rangoons were delicious (that's why it is 2 stars). The Mongolian beef lacked flavor, it was more flavorless than bad beef and broccoli from a mall. Finally, the human chicken tasted off, it wasn't just lacking flavor, the flavor it did have was just bad. Will never eat here or order from them again.
Amazing food and the food was warm when I got it, their fried rice hit the spot and their curry chicken was to die for

The dim sum place we wanted to go to was closed. So, this was actually our second choice. And what a surprise. The pork belly was outstanding, probably one if the best we've had. The staff was very courteous and helpful. A great lunch experience.
Cool on a very hot day. Egg rolls were outstanding.  Kung Po was delicious.  Service was surprisingly great.  No complaints.

The food here is really good quality for very reasonable price. My favorite are their fried pumpkins. They are to die for!! Soooo delicious! But of course you will not regret ordering any of their delicious noodles or fried rice!  This is one of the best places to eat in Chinatown for sure. I would highly recommend you to stop here.
Omg food is out of this world.  Spicy tofu appetizer is addicting.  Great service....
Ordered yesterday. So polite and friendly and the food was amazing my new favorite.

So glad we dined here!  For me it was like stepping back in time.  Dishes were hit and miss--some were really well done and others were just mediocre--but I loved the way we dined.  We sat at a large round table with a lazy susan in the middle.  The food portions were huge!  The dishes were placed on the lazy susan and you could move it and select among the various dishes.  It was delightful and fun.  I haven't done that since I was a kid. Menu is very large--maybe too many options.  Wait staff was very helpful in answering questions and they were very attentive to the table and keeping water glasses full, etc. We will definitely come back here again.

Good quality for price point for a Chinese spot.  Definitely my goto when in Chinatown for a meal.  The cocktails and such are just okay...but their crab rangoon is the best! The baby ginger pineapple chicken is also fantastic and unique.

Few meals make me dance in my seat and Emperor's Choice is one of them. Consistently the best dinner in Chinatown, can't recommend it enough.  To start, you must have one of their blended to order pina coladas. Egg rolls are also a simple yet perfect appetizer - don't miss their sweet sauce with a dash of hot mustard.  Entrees are where this resto really shines. Highlights for me are Mongolian Beef, shrimp in lobster sauce, lobster Cantonese and crispy orange peel beef. I want to bathe in the lobster sauce!!!!  Go with friends - you will need lots of hungry stomachs so you can sample all their wonderful food. Reservations recommended.

I have never actually ate at Emperor's Choice Restaurant. I only go here for take out. But I absolutely love it. It's my go to Chinese restaurant. I love the price, the specials, the sides, the orange chicken, yum. Everything is always so hot when we pick it up, and by the time we bring it home, it's still hot. Love this place, can't go wrong.
We needed a new Chinese carryout spot and this place did not disappoint. Try the pot stickers, they were delicious. The portions are huge, so you won't be left hungry.

If you are trying to decide which restaurant to hit in Chinatown, think no more. I love variety but when I'm back in Chicago I will be eating this delicious Chinese food again!  Of the many restaurants I went to in Chicago, this was a very memorable one.  My group got several dishes and shared them. All of the were really good but the stand outs to me were the hot and sour soup and the sweet and sour sauce. I have had a lot of both of those and the ones I got here may be he best I have ever had.

Thank you Yelpers for your reviews. It helped me to choose this place for a dinner business meeting.  Everything was delicious; the staff didn't rush us though it was dinnertime.  Generous portions of food and a swanky atmosphere made for a truly wonderful dining experience. I am DEFINITELY going to eat here again!!

Usually we go out as a family and choose days where we get to try ethnic dishes. One day we decided to go to Chinatown (favorite spot for me since, I used to come to Chinatown at least once a month due to the fact my dad was a fan).  We like to pick different restaurants to try and see the different variations to enjoy.  Settled on Emperor's Choice this time.  Service by our waitress was extremely attentive and fun.  Family ordered many variations of their dishes.  Food came hot & fresh. we ended up taking some of the dishes back with us for leftovers the next day. We will still try different spots in Chinatown, but Emperor's choice does not disappoint.  Cheers!

Ordered delivery to our hotel based on overall YELP reviews. Young man delivering was very personable. The food arrived sooner than predicted, was hot and as ordered. Sadly, there was nothing that good about the taste.  Did not like their egg roll or dumplings. The fried chicken rice had no flavor. The sweet & sour chicken was soggy in its sauce. Expected more based on reviews.

Overall, a pretty good but not amazing Chinese restaurant in old Chinatown. The price is sharp, so you can't beat it if you're looking for your Chinese classics. We started with the potstickers which were very tender and juicy! Next we had the General Tsaos(which originated in Chicago's very own Chinatown if you didn't know!) and it was really good. Our next dish of beef with pineapple wasn't our favorite...but I probably should have stuck to what I know!

I had dinner here while traveling for business and I it was wonderful. The service was quick, the restaurant was clean. I had the hot and sour soup along with the orange peel chicken. The hot and sour soup was among the best I have had and the orange peel chicken was also good.

We've been coming here for years.  It's a great place for family style dinner.  The food is delicious and the service is prompt.  Our favorite is the steam fish.  One caveat, parking is a hassle.  We'll definitely return.

My office ordered catering from Emperor's today and it was really good!  The food was healthy and fresh and was pleasantly surprised they sent a salad with tomatoes and avocados- so good.  Highly recommended- especially for catering!
Customer service and food both average. Nothing that made me want to go back. My empress chicken was too sweet and my friends beef was too spicy.. I would try somewhere else.

Have found more amazing this to try...the Crispy Green Beans are fantastic appetizer fried in batter and tossed with tasty spices and oil and jalepeno and green peppers FABULOUS MOUTH TREAT! ..... I would recommend getting the large size. I order the Superior Soy Noodles ( I request they toss it with extra garlic) to rest under the main chicken or beef recipe of your choice ( I still favor the General Tso + extra jalepeno) Love this Emperors Choice and we live nearby in Pilsen and they deliver so fast it is crazy.......really nice delivery peoples....tip em good!

My fiancé and I ordered from this restaurant last week. I have been trying various Chinese places in the city to find a great one! To me, the food had highs and lows. We had the crab Rangoon which I thought were really good. The pork lo mein was also excellent. You could tell the veggies were really fresh. The General Tso chicken was not quite what I expected, the sauce was very thin, but the chicken itself was good.  The dumplings were very doughy. At first, I thought the food was kind of expensive, but you do get a lot, we had dinner for two people for two nights. I would recommend ordering food from here, but may skip the general tsos and try another entree next time. Also be prepared for a bit higher price.

Friendly service, very clean, and not too busy so we could get in easily.  The crispy green beans were so good I could have eaten them all day.  I wasn't a fan of the egg foo young but there is so much on the menu I would definitely come back to try other things.
The food was delicious!!  You also get almond cookies and fortune cookies for dessert!!  I especially loved the chow mein, sesame chicken, and the crab rangoon!  Will be ordering again soon!!

Yelp doesn't lie. Emperor's Choice is fantastic. Don't skip the steamed fish fillet in black bean sauce - the fish is delicate, light, and packed with flavor. All of the green veggies are perfectly garlicky and tasty (especially the Chinese broccoli) and the salt and pepper shrimp will always leave you wanting to order more. If you're planning to go on a holiday, say Christmas, do yourself a favor and make a reservation (when we arrived, there was probably a 45 minute wait so we were grateful we had called ahead).  Dinner for four with two cocktails plus tip came to $80.
Great delivery, food arrived hot and crisp (egg rolls, complimentary crab rangoon), soups were steaming and flavorful.  Shanghai noodles spectacular.  Awesome delivery packaging, too.

This place has good reviews and seemed reliable. Most people have a dish or two that they use as a litmus to see how good a place is. For me it's General Tsos chicken and/or sesame chicken since they are essentially the same thing (Chinese American, obviously)  Their sesame chicken and general Tsos were sub par, even by miami standards which are really low. They did use good chicken and ingredients as far as I could tell, but the flavor and sauce were both lacking, and the chicken wouldn't have really stuck to the rice.  Delivery took 70 minutes. Minimum order for delivery says $20 which is a decent amount plus its mandatory $4 delivery fee, before you tip. Gets pricy.  Bottom line, is say this place is "ok" and you won't risk getting food poisoning but if you are looking for a general Tsos fix don't waste it on this place.  Egg rolls were 'ok', wonton soup was 'good' to 'very good'.  Cheers
Love coming here with my family, every single dish we've ever gotten here is delicious.

Yikes. Where did all this 5 stars come from? First, we were one of 4 tables the entire evening (a Thursday) They are clearly hurting. We went here based on Yelp reviews and were so disappointed. We ordered crab Rangoon and 4 entrees -- only the crab Rangoon was good. Every dish was worse than the next. Also ordered a bottle of wine that had clearly been either watered down or switched back and forth between room temp and cold repeatedly (not properly stored). It was a bottle we are familiar with and it was undrinkable. They took it off bill. They wouldn't uncork bottles in front of us. The staff was apologetic and nice - hence the 2nd star. But this place is a hard pass.

Stopped in here after the Cubs parade to grab some grub. I can't say enough good things about this place. The food was delicious and portions were generous. The staff was so friendly and accommodating. The drinks were delicious and the bartender didn't skimp on the booze as some places will which we appreciated. All around wonderful place to try if you're in Chinatown.
Good food, reasonably priced, neighborhood service. We've been here several times and not been disappointed.

We were looking forward to some good Chinese food and saw that this place had 4 stars and some great reviews. Boy was I wrong!! First of all, we had it delivered to our hotel and then realized lately there was no utensils or napkins. Secondly, the food had a weird after taste. We ordered $40 worth of food and we couldn't eat it! We felt like throwing up what we did already consume.  So we wasted money. Definitely not the food we were expecting.
Food did not taste well. It gave you a bad after taste. While delivering to a hotel they refused to add utensils.  I wasted my money.

Bland and not fresh. Frozen packaged dumplings in chinatown? Mushy spring rolls, barely cooked chicken, and calamari. I could go on. I've been to Chinatown in NYC and San Francisco and never had such awful chinese food.
You should really try the shark fins soup. It's so delicious, it's criminal! It's to die for!

The salt and pepper tofu was quite tasty. There is no sauce, so be prepared. This does not take away from the flavor, however. It seems like salt and pepper is their niche, so you may order salt and pepper shrimp, salt and pepper chicken, etc...it all tastes good.  We also had pea shoots in garlic sauce, eggplant and Chinese broccoli in garlic sauce.  Brown rice is available, upon request.  If you have dietary restrictions, they honor them. The servers are friendly and attentive.

The Yelpers really let me down on this one. I don't understand why people love the food here so much. I ordered delivery and had the egg roll (greasy but decent), general tsao chicken (terrible), combination fried rice (bland) and spicy salt & pepper shrimp (bland & soggy). I couldn't even finish my dinner. It was that bad. Maybe it's better if you dine in the restaurant? Regardless, I won't be finding out.

Plan our team outing for Chinatown and this was a great choice. With 12 guest the server did an amazing job at handling each order. Everything came to the table hot and fresh.  The shrimp rolls are very crispy and seasoned well.  The shrimp and lobster sauce was fulfilling. This location has a lunch special as well which made the experince awesome.
I have dined in and had meals picked up , from this location.  The food has always been hot and fast.  I would recommend the Sweet and Sour Chicken!

Very good. The fruity drinks pack a nice punch. Egg rolls and crab Rangoon are not your typical crap you find in most take out Chinese places. All the food is fresher and not as oily or greasy as the norm. The employees are attentive and accommodating.

Deciding to be a tourist in our own city my friends and I thought we would have a adventurous day in Chinatown! And what a fun adventure it was. Starting  off with the water taxi,  we boarded at Michigan Avenue. Great way to see the city and a short 40 minute ride. Once we were there came the hard decision on where to eat and we hit the jack pot with Emperor's Choice. We arrived right when they were opening on Sunday and thank goodness we did because the place started to get packed! Since there was three of us we decide to order a bunch of things and split. Started off with Egg Rolls, Crab Rangoon and Pot Stickers. Honestly the best I've had yet! All the main dishes came with white rice, all piping hot to table and delish! We opted for sesame chicken, Kung Po Chicken and finally a simple Chicken with Snow Peas.  The food was very fresh, service was excellent and always with a smile.
Sweet and sour soup was very good, did not care for crab Ragoons, a little greasy for me. The sweet and sour chicken was very good and rice that came with it. Overall very good experience!

very very very good whole baked fish. I think the most special aspect of the place is the seafood. 5 stars on the fish. Also, some of the tastiest shrimp dishes I have ever had in Chicago. Alot of fun in a big group like on Christmas Day or during Chinese new Year festivities. Our favorite Chinese place in Chinatown proper. For the quality of food not terribly expensive and portions generous. 2 dishes feed 3 easily.

Don't know why this place has a 4 Star rating - very misleading. Food was too salty. I ordered corn soup which was average. The pan fried noodles and hor-fun was SALTY as hell. Fried dumpling's skin was too thick and the sauce paired was weird.  Not the usual sauce. I don't think the local Asians actually come to this place.  This place is mostly for the gway los (non Asians). They give you fortune cookies and some sweet Asian almond cookies which are typically given to tourists.

Yum. Finally I've found my go to Cantonese Chinese food place. Great for pick up, large portions, classic flavors. It's all you need in Chinese carry out. Get the pan fried noodles, they're perfectly soft and crunchy & not too greasy.

The service was friendly and efficient. Food came out hot. The quality of the food was good. Everything was flavorful. Although the potstickers arrived burnt, they were still okay. It was definitely a fresher Chinese food experience when compared to local takeout. However, not really beyond an average Chinese food in general. The restaurant was clean and neat in the dining area, though the bathroom was less than appealing. The floor was sticky, paper tissue balled up and thrown about and the air was anything but fresh. But overall, though not great, this is an okay choice to dine in Chinatown.
Delicious food, and copious amounts. Very welcoming staff that are always there to fulfill any need. Will definitely come back again.

First time being here it's a small but comfortable place to eat. Food was great with good distinct flavors, we ordered com pow chicken and Lo Mein chicken. Plates are usually one size and they are a pretty decent size plate for two or three people. We had to take our left overs to go. Place is a little pricy on some things but it's well worth the money, average plates are $10 and up. Very happy with today's visit our mixed drinks were strong but I actually like them like that.

This is the worst Chinese food I have ever in my life tasted. My boyfriend and I ordered the fried shrimp appetizer, veggie dumplings, sweet and sour chicken, and general tso chicken. The fried shrimp was soaked in complete oil. Although the batter tasted good it was only because of how much oil was left inside of it. I can literally taste the grease all around my lips after each bite. I was extremely disappointed with their veggie dumplings. They were completely dried out and just stuck to each other and on the cabbage. As I tried to take a piece, it kept on falling apart. Both of the chicken dishes were extremely disappointing. The chicken tasted completely dried out and had a taste as if it had been reheated. I'm not sure if we came on a day where the chef was lazy but I would never return to this place. It was just a total fail and I wish I could have had a good food experience in China town but that wasn't the case. Either these reviewers don't know what good Chinese food is or we just came on a wrong day. I feel bad for giving this place one star because the service was good and our server was really nice so I had to add an extra star. As far as the food goes I would rate it one star. I don't recommend this place if you're wanting good Chinese food in china town. I'm pretty sure there are way better places than here.

The best part of coming to Chicago! This time we came for lunch and it was still delicious. Service was quick but since there were only 2 waitstaff, getting drink refills was a challenge.  The food was amazing, I love the chicken fried rice and had beef and broccoli for the first time.  My family and I enjoy eating here and we'll continue to come as part of our trips to Chicago!
Everything was GREAT, except the egg rolls... Not much flavor or meat. Service and as good and we will be back again next year

This was the most bland Chinese food I have ever eaten in my life. Dare I speak of the mutant broccoli that look like the size of plums. I will say that delivery was crazy fast,  but I like to eat my Asian food with flavor. Gonna start sticking with my Thai and Japanese establishments. I seriously can't order from them again.

Visiting Chicago for a convention.  Staying at Hyatt Regency McCormick Place. Had to stay there because needed to be at the convention center. The hotel is great ( a review of that coming soon ) The only problem is it is in the middle of nowhere for places to eat. Restaurants are not really walking distance to/from the hotel.  Taking a cab to a restaurant can get pricy . Restaurants at the hotel nothing to brag about.  Thanks to an Yelp app called eat24 I found a great Chinese restaurant that delivers to the hotel room.   Emperor's Choice was the excellent choice.  Food was delivered on time , was hot , fresh and tasted yummy. Worth every dollar spent. Portions were big. Spicy as needed to be. Delivery charge $3 only. That is a great deal. When ordering food be sure to check box for plates and utensils ( fork , spoon etc ) Or it may arrive without. I will be ordering again tonight.
Great food and fast delivery! A bit on the pricey end but i'll definitely be ordering from here again!

Just solid Americanized Chinese cuisine. And of higher quality. My dad and step mom ordered pot stickers for the appetizer, hot tea, and hot n sour soup. Pot stickers were nice and fat, and can easily be a meal. Hot n sour soup was on point too. For the main course, I ordered the spicy beef with jalapeños, peppers, chili peppers. The heat factor is on -- as my taste buds were along a roller coaster. It's really hot! You've been forewarned! Dad ordered the nest of noodles. His own beef dish, and vegetable with shrimps and squid. I had a little bit of everything side from the squid because I'm not a fan of it. Great place in old Chinatown.
Fantastic!  What a great experience. Good was so good and the staff were a 10 out of 10. Definite go to place in Chinatown.

I had lunch here today after a tour of the Chinatown Library.  We shared the crab Rangoon, it's wonderful!  I had the Shanghai noodles also very good, so good looking that the table next to us asked what I was eating.  One of my lunch mates had the moo shu pork, yummy pancake goodness.  I went home and told my husband about them so what did we do for dinner tonight?  We ordered moo shu pork, egg rolls which are also very good and Hunan chicken which is great.  This is a small restaurant with friendly staff and great food.

This place is unassuming from the front but once inside and scanning the menu you will be pleasantly surprised. For starters we had the dumplings which plainly put are some of the best you will find in Chinatown. Main dishes were done with the right amount of spice and flavor. I had the spicy eggplant which whenever I see eggplant I must order and it was well worth it. Every time I tried to stop to leave leftovers I couldn't the food was that good. The dishes are big sized portions which easily leave you enough for leftovers if can you stop. There are many choices but this is definitely a place well worth checking out.

The service was prompt even though the waitstaff seemed to have a difficult time with English. I had to pull the guy aside and explain very carefully, because he wasn't very clear and I was afraid that I would end up eating a shrimp by accident as a result of the communication barrier.  The food was good. The appetizers were absolutely amazing.  My problem was I was apart of a large group dining here and there was an overpowering souring smell. It was like soured mop water that was a month old. It took my nose hostage the moment I walked in the foot, and if I would have been alone or on my personal time I would have walked out immediately. I stayed, I endured, and overheard several others making the same comments.  I still wonder where the stench was coming from.

GREAT restaurant. Loved the lunch special - very reasonably priced for a soup, egg roll, meat entree, and rice. Also got a drink and the total was $12 (also came with 2 cookies at the end). Food was all very good. The staff were very friendly and the service was fast.
Nice lunch specials. Fast. Tasted good. I am from SF and thought the food was of the same quality as back home.
Great food, reasonable prices, and a clean, nice atmosphere.  Staff were responsive and cordial.  I would return again!  Also, big portions for dinner!

This restaurant is a great stop in China Town. Wonderful food, large portions, friendly and attentive staff make this a great place to stop when you're hungry. Combine that with free almond cookies after your meal and it's a win win! FYI - lunch specials are not available on the weekends.

This is a good choice for an authentic Chinatown experience and meal. The restaurant is upscale and clean and the service is good. The portions are large ( which is great for a group) and the food is very good. We particularly liked the egg rolls which may be best I'v had. Groups can sit at tables with lazy Susan's which makes it a great choice for a group of 6. The location is in the heart of Chinatown which makes it a fun destination.

Great food. Large portions. Our 4 generation family sampled Pineapple Chicken , walnut Shrimp, Peking duck, and some appetizers. Everything was really good. 2 year old was loving the edamame and crab Rangoon. Staff was really nice and always kept drinks full.  Definitely would stop here again. Very well decorated restaurant and bathrooms were very nice also.
So happy we found this place. We ordered beef w Chinese broccoli and Shanghai noodles. Both fantastic.  The cookies were a great bonus.  Delivery to my house was about an hour. Worth it.

This is the best place for Chinese food in Chicago. The softshell crab (in season):is fresh and spicy. I also recommend salt and pepper shrimp or scallops. The Singapore noodles are excellent, and vegetables are always fresh. The service is fast, and the staff is extremely friendly. Highly recommended.

Ordered online this weekend. Two orders of egg rolls paid for, only one arrived. Still good egg rolls, wish I would have got the full order. That was unfortunately the highlight of the meal. Crispy salty beef was SALTY. Beyond expectation salty. Almost inedible salty. Even sweet and sour sauce didn't help. Chicken lo mein had everything you could expect, with lots of vegetables, but very bland. Won't order again. Especially considering they owe me money.

I tried the preserved egg. It was yummy and but portion, good for two people. The food was spicy and so was the small salad served before the meal. I also tried the mango boba tea which was nice and not too sweet.

Update - the quality seems to have gone down here.  The last few times I ordered it hasn't been as good (skimped on noodles in some dishes, too greasy etc).  I'm hoping they get it back together soon.  We live near china town and have tried several restaurants.  Emperors choice is by far the best we've had!  We've ordered delivery many times and have eaten in.  The food quality is consistently good.  The staff members are super nice and the interior of the restaurant is very clean. My favorite dishes are the general tsos and Kung bao beef.

Huge portions. Fresh ingredients. Great service. Typical American-Chinese, though they did have some specialties I'd never heard of.  Insanely busy, but the staff handled it well. Very impressed. Funny waitress who took care of business.  The only thing I wish I had thought of was telling them to up the spice level. My dishes said they were spicy on the menu, but I wanted a little more sweat with my lunch. Ma Po Tofu -- First time trying this dish, and I'm grateful I tried it here instead of someplace else. Good! Came with peas, which was a great surprise. Big slices of jalapeno for just the right level of spice.  Friends had chicken dishes. Both delicious, but my favorite was the "dry" noodle dish. The noodles got caramelized and a little crunchy!  Salt and pepper green beans -- Whoa, really salty. But addictive. Super light crunchy breading. If you're very sensitive to salt, then avoid. Decent shrimp fried rice.  Enough to feed us for another two days. : D

The food here is really good and the seating is decent as well. I even strayed away from my "go-tos" and was not disappointed. They actually have a drink menu for those of you that care about that. The service here is suprisingly awesome as well.
Best I've ever had.  Spicy salt and pepper chicken was out of this world!  Lightly breaded crispy perfect.

I highly recommend this place. It feels good to know that when you go to a restaurant they appreciate you. I want to try other restaurants in the area, but this place will always have my support. Not only is the food good, but it's fresh. When comparing this restaurant to those outside of Chinatown in other neighborhoods, it's not the same. If you want good quality food and food that will taste good days later....this is your spot! I'm never disappointed.

I'm originally from Chicago, however I lived out of state for 16 years and wanted to a new Chinese restaurant. I ordered take out and the chicken fried rice and egg rolls are delicious!! The service was great!! I highly recommend for a good place for dinner.

Came to Chicago to visit from NJ and I must say this place had amazing service and amazing food. The only compliant was that the pinã colada was very watery but that's so minor because again the food was wonderful.

I first have to start off with great customer service! He treated us amazing! We ordered the spicy salt and pepper shrimp and spicy salt and pepper squid they were on point! We also ordered egg drop soup it tasted really good. This was our first time there and it certainly will not be our last time!

We ordered To Go, picked up our food and drove home. Opened the bag, the two egg rolls we ordered and were charged for were missing. The Mongolian Beef should have been named Mongolian Vegetables since we counted six pieces of beef. The Moo Shu pork tasted just ok, but there was very little pork and the pancakes had holes in the middles. We say stay away from this restaurant unless your goal is to be disappointed.

After living in Chicagoland for almost 30 years, we finally made it to Chinatown. Since we love Asian culture and foods, I can't believe it took us so long. After being in Chinatown in NYC, Philadelphia and San Francisco, Chicago's is much smaller. But they do have a wide variety of restaurants for all tastes. Originally, we chose another restaurant by looking at reviews on Yelp. But, we arrived a little early and while browsing through shops, I asked the clerk "where the locals go." She said Emperor's Choice (right across the street from this shop) was the place to go. Emperor's Choice is not a large restaurant, and it was early when we arrived so there were seats available. Over the course of the couple of hours we were there, it filled up. We ordered a variety of items - soup, noodle, shrimp and beef dishes. The food was hot when served and it was excellent. For a Chinese restaurant recommended by a local person, I was surprised that the menu was a pretty traditional Americanized version of Chinese food. They had a few traditional offerings, but it was not what I expected it to be. However, as I said, what we ate was very good. I need to say something about their service. I unfortunately did not get the waitresses name but she was outstanding. She kept coming by our table to make sure everything was good, she kept the tea pot and water glasses filled at all times, and was very helpful navigating the menu. I really can't say enough about how much she made the experience all that much better.
Very good We had the shrimp and lobster sauce and the emperor's chow fun Great service too
Very good place!..good food for a Very good price and very friendly service!!..only could use a bit more room for the dinning area..other than that, Great place!!
My current go to for Chinese delivery.  Ordering online through yelp is easy and delivery is always fast and hot.  The food is tasty.
Great traditional chinese!  Good delivery too, food arrived on time and hot.  Highly recommend.

We won't be ordering from Emperor's Choice again. Cons: -The food was both bland and super greasy -They didn't include rice in our order. Their menu states it should have come with our order but it didn't. -We requested extra pancakes for our Moo shu pork. They gave us one extra. -I couldn't identify the meat(s) in the Moo shu pork. It looked like there was more than one type, some very dark, some very light. Pros: -None.

Three of us picked up takeout from here. I don't even remember what we ate, because everything was so tasteless it didn't even register. Really wanted to like this place, but out of 3 entrees, an appetizer, and soup, all I can say is that the food was ready on time and the people were pleasant when we picked up our order.

Best Chinese food ever!  Very fresh and the waitresses were so nice.  We had Peking Duck (need to order the day before) and it was excellent.  Table side service by the waitress.  Egg Rolls like no other.  Not greasy.  Everything we had was very flavorful and very fresh.  Egg Foo Yung not in a heavy sauce.   My 11 year old niece had the Beef and Broccoli and asked what was wrong with the broccoli because she NEVER had broccoli that fresh in her Beef and Broccoli before.  I cannot say enough about Emperors Choice.  Go there you won't be disappointed.
Solid delivery option at the Hyatt Regency at McCormick Place.  Both Wonton Soup and Eggrolls were above average and the Salt and Pepper Shrimp was quite nice.

Absolutely in love with Emperor's Choice. My mother and I visited Chinatown two weeks ago on a Sunday afternoon. We got our table just minutes before the lunch croud. *whew* The service here is spot on. Somewhat better than any of the other establishments on this street! We ordered egg drop soup and egg rolls to start.  The egg rolls were fantastic and fresh. The house made sauce was also quite great! I did not have any of the soup but my mother really loved it. The portion sizes for our two entrees were HUGE. In fact I had lunch for two extra days at work. Both dishes were deliciously prepared and full of spices, juiciness in the meat, and piping hot. I cannot wait to return.
standard american-chinese food, delivered quick and fresh. hits the spot, but nothing to write home about,

I went to the Emperors Garden and ordered the Mongolian beef and was disappointed.  The dish had no green onions and was over salted instead of being sweet and salted as it is supposed to be.  I had to ask for hoisin sauce on the side in an attempt to balance the horrible saltiness of this dish but it did not help.  I will have to try better places than this because this is the worst Mongolian beef I have ever tasted.

Four of us stopped by for an early dinner and were thoroughly pleased. Everything was hot, fresh, and tasty. Service was great. We had Lo Mein with Shrimp, Sweet & Sour Pork, Beef & Broccoli, Won Ton Soup, Vegetable Soup, & Shrimp Rolls. Highly recommend.
Food was fabulous.  We had  the shrimp rolls, the won ton soup, the broccoli beef and the sweet and sour pork.  It was better than any oriental food we have eaten.

General Tso's was good, but the walnut shrimp was flawless and took me away to my special place, as well as beautifully presented on the platter. Treat yourself with it. Service was prompt and my drink was kept refilled. Like I said, treat yourself.

This place is great for good food and fast delivery!  The portions are very generous and they always pack extra sauces and cookies.  I'm not a huge fan of Shrimp Egg Foo Young but my boyfriend is and so he always orders it when we find it on a menu.  I have to admit I LOVE this dish there!  This will definitely be my go-to place when I'm craving Chinese.  Only negative (which is why I left off one star) I have yet to try a chicken dish that I really enjoy, but I will keep trying!  Great place overall!

I've gotta guess that the Salt & Pepper shrimp is the house specialty. That's the only thing I ordered and it was one of the best things I've ever eaten. Can't speak to anything else, though. Lightly breaded shrimp. Shrimp that are big, juicy, and firm pink flesh. Mixed in with an assortment of sliced peppers. Not served in a fishy tasting broth. Just tasted like really fresh ingredients. Loved it. I am always SO disappointed by shrimp at Chinese restaurants; usually they are small, few, and slightly discolored.  But these... make up for every nasty shrimp I've ever eaten. Real talk. I called my boyfriend after I ate it and raved about them for like 20 minutes to the point where he was just like... shut up. BUT I KNOW HE WOULD LOVE THEM, TOO! AND SO WILL YOU!

The food was ......meh....   I went here for lunch just to try something new. The food was your typical Chinese food no frills. I ordered the orange chicken dish which was ok. I liked the fact the the chicken bites were small and unlike many Chinese restaurants who oftentimes give you huge unmanageable chunks of chicken. I would order from this place again if I need a quick bite of Chinese but if you're looking for taste Id try somewhere else.
Kung Pao Chicken had no great flavors needed broccoli in it, chicken just wasn't great. Other meal was sesame chicken and it was decent, little disappointed overall

I have been craving delicious Chinese food now for a couple weeks; other than Panda Express. I went down to Chinatown and chose this place! It was delicious alright! The Spicy Salt and Pepper shrimp was amazing! The taste was so unique; starts off sort of sweet and then a salty spice! It is lightly breaded, though it doesn't make you feel like you are eating something fried.  Can't wait to go back!

Cheap family-style restaurant with quality food. The waiter was amazing and suggested all the right dishes for my family of 14 visiting town. He only made us order as much as we needed and brought an array of lovely dishes. All were great but everyone loved the coconut shrimp, orange chicken and shrimp-fried rice the most. I would reccommend Emeror's Choice to anyone wanting an authentic family-style chinese meal with dishes from all over China.

Excellent food, small space, but food is very well prepared! (vegetables aren't mushy) Service is friendly. Get your parking stub validated, and parking was only $2.00. We shopped afterwards, at Chinatown Bazaar- fun afternoon!

Some of the best Chinese food I've ever eaten at amazing prices. I ordered the lunch Shanghai Rice Noodles combo, which came with a Hot & Sour soup and 2x Crab Rangoons.  Additionally, I ordered a Cripsy Tofu appetizer. The soup wasn't spicy (maybe I should have asked them to kick it up a little), but it was full of amazing fresh veggies.  The Rangoons were cooked perfectly, nice and crispy, but had very little crab in them (mostly cream cheese).  The Shanghai Rice Noodles was amazing.  The portion was huge, the meat was cooked perfectly (large shrimp and pork servings), the veggies were crips/fresh.  The saffron flavoring just popped in this dish and I highly recommend it to anyone.  The Crispy Tofu had a great salt/pepper flavoring with the addition of jalapeño added for a mild spice kick.   The restaurant is very clean with white linen tables.  The bathrooms are well cared for.  The wait staff is extremely professional.   Overall, a great restaurant for a family, couples, business meetings, or just a solo patron looking for a great meal at an affordable price (extremely cheap for the Chicago area).

My grandmother chose this place for her birthday lunch. I say "birthday lunch" and you think, "aw, cute. A small lunch". No. My grandma rolls in with 50 people for her birthday. We almost took over the whole place.  It's modern. It's clean. The bathrooms are lovely. I was worried. How could such a nice place have delicious, authentic food? Are they catering to lo fan?  Luckily, the food was AMAZING. Everything we had was fantastic. My grandma ordered banquet style so each table of 10 had the same thing. A steak and asparagus dish that was cooked perfectly was a big favorite. The lobster was cooked perfectly. The noodle dishes were crispy.  I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place! get in and try it!

Delicious meal! For starters the seaweed soup with pork set the stage for an amazing meal! The Chinese broccoli with shrimp was excellent and paired nicely with the Crispy Chilean Sea Bass. Service was very pleasant and very efficient . Overall experience super fantastic

This is my first time eating chinese food in Chicago. It concerned me when we walked in and realized a lack of Asian people at this restaurant. I perceived that as a lack of authenticity. But we decided to try it out regardless.  We ordered the soft shelled crab, sizzling black peppered beef, and garlic stir fried snowpea leaves. They turned out to be pretty good, didn't give me the cheap asian takeout food feeling. The dining environment was good for chinese restaurant (I guess this is an important aspect to attract non-asian customers). Clean floor, white table cloth, clean and non smelly bathroom.

I have only ordered delivery from here so not very accurate as for their service or other menu items. However, their food was not as good as I was hoping.  The sweet and sour shrimp was essentially fried shrimp with too much breaking and the sauce (came on the side) was no sweet and sour shrimp I've ever had before and had chunks of tomatoes and green peppers that were haphazardly thrown in. Do not reccomend. Their calamari was chewy and also over breaded. Asked for mild spicy flavor and got no spicy ness.  Their vegetable dumplings were the only thing I liked but was mediocre.
Food was great.  Best hot and sour soup I have ever had. Crab Rangoon came with the lunch special that was also great!!

Me and the family ended up here because the original place we were supposed to go was closed for renovations. Turned out to be a blessing in disguise. We had dinner here on mothers day which we expected to be packed but we were immediately seated. To start off we had some long island iced teas and they were not shy with the liquor which is how I like my drinks. For the apps we had egg rolls, bbq pork, and wonton soup. Egg rolls were nice and crispy and flavorful. Bbq pork was tender and the sauce was delicious. The wonton soup was good and not watered down like a lot of places make it. For our entrees we had combination fried rice, mongolian beef, sweet and sour chicken. All of the food was excellent as well as the customer service . I do not have one negative comment about this place and I cant wait to go back and have it again.

Disclaimer: I only got 3 appetizer dishes here and not any of the entrees.  I ordered take out from here on a whim, and it was definitely worth it! Here's why -  Crab Rangoon - The best I've had in Chicago so far. For starter, you get 6 pieces, which totally beats the 4 that you'd get at some other places for the same price. They're actually crispy and not soggy (mind you, I ordered them to take out and had a 30 min trip back to my place). There's also this garlic-y taste to them that I thought was great.  Emperor's Egg Rolls - This was also fried perfectly. I'm not completely sure what is inside them. I'm guessing it was something along the lines of cabbage, a little sliced scallion, some tiny shrimp, and maybe a few other basic ingredients.  Bar-B-que Pork - I know people have been saying this place is highly Americanized, and I'm not going to argue over that, but these pieces of sliced bbq pork were made just like how I'd get them at legit Chinese food places in NY. The slices have just the right amount of meat and fat and they're not dry at all!  The only thing that annoyed me was that they didn't give me any type of duck sauce or anything along those lines for the egg roll or crab rangoon, but I guess I'd also have to blame myself for not asking. Besides that, this place was great and I look forward to going back and trying their other dishes.

clean & modern space, full bar (excellent spirit/wine/beer options), and most importantly -- delicious, authentic Chinese food (freshest seafood flown in weekly (on Thursdays))! very friendly staff, and the food is consistently good -- order the razor clams, pepper/salt seafood, lemongrass chicken, any of the vegetable dishes -- DELICIOUS!!

When it comes to great American Chinese delivery in the South Loop, Emperor's Choice takes the cake. Whoever picks up the phone and takes my order is always pleasant and helpful. Delivery is always much faster than the estimate they give you. And even the delivery guy is always very friendly.  But most important of all - the food has been consistently delicious. I love their sesame chicken. The crab rangoons are excellent. They even went out of their way to prepare a dish I love that's not even on their menu, Chow Fun with Beef in Black Bean sauce - and it was the best I've ever had!

Wow, this must be one of the most cleanest Chinese restaurants in Chinatown that I have been to. It was a bit of shock as the exterior signage didn't seem to indicate that it might be anything like the interior. I have to say that it really affected my mood in a good way that the place felt nice and relaxed. The staff was very attentive making sure they were around when we were ready to order. We got the General Tso's Chicken, Ginger & Onion Fried Lobster, Sichuan Fish Filet, Salty and Spicy Seafood, and Garlic Fried Peapod Leaves. All of it was very flavorful and delicious. I have to say I was disappointed that they were out of crab though. The portions and prices were reasonable, and I would certainly like to come back.

In all honestly, if half-stars were an option, this one would be a 3.5. However, due the beautiful interior and consistent attention-to-detail, I'm bumping them to 4. Unlike most of their counterparts in Chinatown, Emperor's Choice keeps their establishment meticulously clean and their wares up to date. This is by far the most aesthetically pleasing of the restaurants I've been to in Chinatown, except maybe Kai, but much cleaner. I don't know if they've recently updated their decor, as this was my first time dining here, but they did a great job. Tables are pristine, bathrooms spic and span, and the bar when you walk in didn't have a crumb on it. Definitely a welcoming place!  Food was good! We tried the hot and sour soup, which was among the best I've ever had. For entrees, we ate the Hunan Beef, which features some of the freshest veggies I've ever tasted. The fresh bamboo was my favorite, as I had only had this in chute form, previously. Beef was extremely lean, which is always great. The seafood dish was not as good, but still tasty. It had shrimp, squid, scallops, jalapeno peppers, and snow peas. Scallops are my favorite, and I wish there were more than three or four of them in the dish. Server was routinely checking up on us, but not in an overbearing, creepy way like some servers in Chinatown.  While this isn't my favorite in Chinatown, I'll add it to my list of options every time I go back. Disclaimer: I go back quite often and refuse to eat Chinese in Chicago outside of Chinatown.

Uh-may-Zing!!!! The food here is simply the best Chinese food I've ever had. Very fresh & the good tasted like it had not been sitting under a heat lamp all day ether  That is not fast food. So, of you're looking for that, there always Panda Express. The food takes it's time because they're making it on the spot. Can't beat that! Great service too. Very family friendly.

The Singapore Noodle and Moo Shoo pork was fabulous.  Orange chicken not so much.  Loved the service.  Plates were clean and beautiful.  Plastic rather than disposable chopsticks.  Tasty sauces - which truly differentiates Chinese resturants.
Do not order the beef fried rice, mongolian beef or won ton soup unless you are restricted to a bland diet, devoid of any and all spices, seasonings or taste for that matter... waste.of.money... :(

Stopped in for lunch one day after doing some work at a nearby school. I ordered the General Tso's chicken w/ rice lunch special. The portion was HUGE! It also came with soup and an egg roll (or was it Crab Rangoon?)...can't recall. Either way, there are plenty of places to eat in Chinatown but Emperor's Choice should be your first choice! Especially if you find yourself roaming the area and are looking for good food and quick service.

Service was outstanding and food was even better! Get the crunchy green beans they are to die for, along with the hot and sour soup. Definatly would reccomend for anyone visiting the city or just trying to chow down on some asian cuisine.

The food was delicious! Starting with the seaweed salad and crispy green beans, which came out quickly. Both dishes were very tasty and set the tone for our entrees..... broiled whitefish with black bean sauce and vegetable egg foo young with brown rice.... Both were well seasoned and fresh... My sister and I definitely enjoyed our dinner... Only complaint is that the restaurant is kind of small and the tables are extremely close together.... it's not conducive for private conversations or even a quiet dinner.

Haven't been there for a while and I'm happy to see they newly remodeled the whole restaurant. New menu, new plates, new bathroom. This is definitely a fresh experience to me.  I love the Peking Duck, spicy eggplant, and lemon grass pork. Fried rice is good too. I'll try their lobster next time when I go with friends.

When my cousin from Taiwan came to visit, I had to rack my brain as to what food would be good for him to try. I suggested maybe we can try American Chinese food to which he responded with "Huh? What's that?" And so I embarked on a journey to find what would be a good American Chinese restaurant for me to take out for him to try. I ended up here at this restaurant because it was closest to me at that point in time. I got the orange peel chicken, kung po chicken, and black pepper beef. I absolutely love the orange peel chicken. It's not as sweet like how most restaurants make it. You can really taste the orange when eating this dish. The kung po chicken and black pepper beef are also very good. All these dishes were a hit with him.  And of course, American Chinese food is not complete without fortune cookies so we also had them. Service is decent enough. I was ignored the first few minutes when I arrived at this restaurant but once I was seated, they were pretty attentive.

I've been eating at this place for the past 8 years and they have been continuously updating their menu and decor. Food is tasty especially if you like spicy food and all ingredients are cooked correctly especially the vegetables that always taste delicious and are always crispy. Service is extremely prompt and welcoming which doesn't happen often in Chinatown
Nice interior and fast, friendly service. Singapore noodles here are the best I've had anywhere.
The food here is so fresh and affordable. The green tea was only $2! And the potstickers are divine. A friend of mine recommended this restaurant to me, and she was spot on!

I've been at EC probably 30 times over the years and always viewed it as a reliable and sometimes excellent place.  But I was there 7/27/14 and it was mediocre.  The food was dumbed down to satisfy bland palates.  (This is not a matter of spice, but of taste.)  Service was fine -- brough chopsticks but you had to ask.  I'll probably give it another try for old times sake but am really distressed.

I had been here once in high school on a trip, and I remembered the food being much better that time than it was when I ate there with my boyfriend.  We had the crab rangoon and some sort of fried noodles, along with green tea. The tea was lovely, with a refreshing, warm taste. The crab rangoon was truly odd, though. They were sort of greasy and super garlicky. Usually garlic wouldn't bug me, honestly I love garlic, but it just tasted weird. Our noodles tasted good, but they were also really greasy. We also had a hard time getting service from our waiter at times.  It wasn't the worst, but it was just sort of meh. Maybe a little less grease and a little more attention from the staff.

My 2nd time in Chinatown Chicago, and I wanted to try a place that was a little more upscale instead of a cheap, big eat place with no ambiance and décor like most places around here. Had no problem paying $10 or more as long as the food was good quality and I got it here. My friends had the eggrolls and I tried pot stickers and was not disappointed. All appetizers come with three different sauces and I must say, the hot mustard sauce was spicy and tasty. I got the show mien noodles with shrimp and again I wasn't disappointed and my friends got poultry and rice and were impressed. I enjoyed the ambiance of this restaurant. White table cloths and Asian music in the background made me feel like I was at a more classy restaurant. The service also deserved high praise. I am one that always likes to try different places, but I would go here again and suggest this place to friends.

Great service, fast and attention to detail.  Had the duck,  soo yummy!  Mixed fried ruc rice was delicious.  Reservations are suggested,  place gets packed from one minute to another.   Will go back, must definitely to try their lobster,  saw a lot of those being ordered.
Great food, excellent service...a little pricier than some of the others in Chinatown but very good food!
Best Kung Pao chicken ever! Quick friendly service. Large portions. A little expensive, but we go there every time we're in Chinatown.

Excellent main courses. The crab Rangoon was quite fishy tasting though, so I would not recommend ordering that. For the main course I ordered beef and broccoli which was very good. We were served family style since we had 6 people.
Over rated on yelp.  Soup was acceptable, food service egg rolls, processed chicken in chicken and black bean sauce.  Soupy.

Wow. Well, I will never listen to other Yelpers ever again. You guys.... you.. guys... how could you?  I've been trying to find a new place to get salt and pepper tofu because the place I go isn't in the best neighborhood but theirs is delicious. Plus, it's kind of sad that I live walking distance from Chinatown and I've never eaten there.  Since there are so many choices I figured Yelp would be the best place to look so that I could narrow down the choices. I went to this place because all of the comments about the salt and pepper tofu were great, things like "surprise of the meal!" and "tofu packed with flavor" had me VERY excited to try it.  Well, I can say I sure was surprised.... Especially given the reviews. The tofu almost tasted like water.... like it had NO FLAVOR.... Salt and pepper tofu? It tasted like little chunks of water. I couldn't taste any salt, and no pepper... I mean and it wasn't just the tofu, it was the vegetables in it. It was as if someone deliberately sucked all of the flavor out of the dish to crush my spirit.  So yeah.. that happened. Then the spring rolls, I don't know what was in them, but it was something very slimy and gooey about them. The only vegetable I know that does that is okra... yeah it was okra slimy. I don't want to leave such a bad review because the servers and were very nice and patient with me but... there's bland and then there....eating air.... Plus the slimy spring rolls :(
Nice ambiance, good service and clean restroom. Cantonese crispy chicken noodle was a little salty and not flavorful.  Only about 20% of noodles were crispy because they didn't deep fried them.

This is my second review of this restaurant, but my first review of the current, new mmanagement. The newer, intended to be hipper, decor actually took the whole romantic notion of a Chinatown restaurant away. It now has an "awkward" vibe; a kind of an identity crises, if you will. The food might be the same as before on the most part, but it doesn't "taste" as good because the atmosphere doesn't quite fit the food and the mood. They also raised the prices, which causes you to be more critical. This used to be our go-to, nice-dinner, special occasion, take-your-time-and-enjoy-it kind of place even you did already pay more than your average Chinatown restaurant prices. And it used to remind me of the same kind of nostalgic, old school（in a very good way）experiences you'd get from places like the Palmer House, or Marshall Field's. Now, it's ordinary at best and has totally lost its original charms. You used to also feel they'd take good care of you when you dined there, that's gone too.  What a shame!

As another reviewer noted, this restaurant is trying to cater to the American crowd with the telling signs being the decor, menu, and higher prices.  Why go down to Chinatown to have Americanized experience?   The best part or the meal was the egg rolls.  All the others dishes we ordered we disappointing.   Restaurant appeared clean and wait staff and service was fast and attentive.

To be honest I love all Chinese food for the most part but this place was OK/ forgettable. It wasn't bad but it wasn't anything like Golden Chef. If you are in the Humbolt Park area(or their respective delivery area) look up Golden Chef, everything I've ever had from there is on point. The only bad thing is that they close at 9 or 10. If it's after 9 or 10, I guess you can order Emperor's Choice.

Since I have last been here, they remodeled.  Everything is new from the floors to the painted ceilings.  The bar is moved to the other side and the layout is different - the ambiance has changed a little as it feels more "open" and there is a slight echo as a fountain runs in the background.  However, I am happy to report the food is exactly the same and the menus are also NEWLY designed (but the food is the same.)
My favorite restaurant in Chinatown! I found this place by accident and Im in love ever since. Food is always great! Seafood is always fresh! If you love shrimps you must try salt and pepper shrimps!

This review is for a delivery order. I I have ordered from may Chinese restaurants but this was the first one that did not fill the containers to the top. (two dishes were in a large container but only filled up 1/2 way. Would hate to see the small order). When placing the order they ask if you want a small or large order for most everything. we ordered large. A large meal from other places means enough for dinner, a snack later on and lunch tomorrow. This place each dish was barely enough for one meal. Worse yet, we ordered four dishes and it cost $60! While the food was pretty tasty, the portions were way too small, especially for the price.

I agree with all of the positive reviews here, this is the best Chinese food I've ever had in my life. First trip to Chinatown was a great success. I recommend the String Bean Stir Fry, it was savory and delicious. Had some kick but not too spicy either. And the complimentary cookies were icing on the cake!!

My husband and I took the red line to Chinatown yesterday to watch the Chinese New Year parade and afterwards went and had a bite to eat at Emperors Choice restaurant. It was wonderful. The food is excellent and the service is great! If you have a chance to go be sure to say hi to Don from Tony and Deb. Enjoy!

I came to this restaurant a few times with my family, friends and a co-worker. We quite like the food here, such as its soft shell crab, orange beef, chicken and Singapore noodle. I much liked the drink too.

After reading some reviews my family decided we'll try this place. At first I thought the menu looked very American until I asked the waiter for suggestions he suggested the steamed oysters which where phenomenal we also got the soft shell crab, also phenomenal. Highly recommend this place!

If there was minus rating I would use it for this place, we went as a group of 7 as we were in China Town and this place was the highest rated so we decided to have lunch here The place's ambiance below average the service was not bad though and those three only not bad things in this restaurant When we were ordering I asked if they have the Sichuan beef as I didn't find it on the menu and the waiter said they do have it, anyways when the food came, most of us got shocked of how did the noodle even look like, we asked them to take it back, we had two exact the same beef dishes the waiter claimed that one of them is Cong pau and the other is Sichuan beef which doesn't look like Sichuan beef at all, the beef was almost raw, the beef teppanyaky was terrible which is kind of basic even the spring rolls tasted kinda weird We had a really bad experience here and I'll make sure to stay away from this place

This place is definitely one of my favorites in Chinatown. It is a little bit more on the pricy side but is so worth it if you are in the mood for some great chinese food. The atmosphere is nice and the food is excellent. It is hard to go wrong with their menu and in my experience, the service has been excellent.
Ace service, bomb food, and pretty clean for the average Chinatown eatery. To me, this speaks 5 stars. Make sure you get the family dinner, it gives good portions at a good price!

It's not that this place is a bad restaurant, but it's definitely an American-Chinese restaurant. No matter what some people who've been to China might say, 1/4 of the dishes not only can't be found in China, but were first made for Americans. This doesn't mean bad, just not "authentic".  That being said, the green beans with pork was quite nice. Not happy that they charged me for tea, esp. since they charge $1.25 per person. Our server was nice and helpful. And at the end of the meal they give you almond cookies, which will cause me to look more fondly upon any establishment. Final verdict: I wouldn't say no to going back if someone else wanted to go there, but I don't think I'll go back on my own.

We got off the bus, I Yelped the highest rated restaurants w/ in 2 blocks and  Emperor's Choice Restaurant popped up. It was everything I was hoping for when we went to Chinatown on our first stop in Chicago. Great atmosphere, good food and even better prices.  I needed an extra fork to keep my wife and kids from trying to eat my General Zhao Chicken. They didn't like their entrees nearly as much as mine. (Why don't they just order what I order for Pete's sake?)  The service was very good and the Crab Rangoon actually had crab in it! It was the best meal I had on our 7 day vacation and cost about half of what we spent everywhere else.

I am Chinese and from Southern California.  A friend from California told us about Emperor's Choice and we made to trip to Chinatown.  Now this restaurant is in the old part of Chinatown, don't let the older surroundings discourage you the food is good. My wife loves crab, so we ordered the fried soft shell crab with peppers and chili's was great. We also ordered green beans with pork and fish fillets with stir fried vegetables.  This was more than enough for us three.   The menu is in English and Chinese, the staff is Cantonese but speaks English.  They are friendly and helpful. One of the owners Don Eng came by I broke out my rusty Chinese. He was born and raised in the US as I so it was a mix of English and Chinese. I learned that he and other partners had taken over the restaurant. Apparently they had the same cooks.  The food was tasty and fairly priced.  We had a very good meal.

Great choice. I've been to Asia and eaten real Chinese food all over the world. Great food- Crab in black bean sauce, seafood and standards. Excellent service Nice atmosphere. Good Prices. Can't beat this place for authentic Chinese food and service.

Good food, a bit overpriced plus you have to pay to park.  However, the customer service is lacking.  Yesterday, I got the wrong order.  I called and talked to the owner.  He said it was my fault for not checking the bag.  He said there was nothing he could do.  I told him I would bring back the food.  He said "Not my fault. And I remember you.  You took the wrong bag."  How can you remember me via my telephone voice?!? And you did not serve me. Was the restaurant so slow you remember every customer.  And if you saw me pick up the bag why didn't you tell me to check the bag!! Needless to say, I am NOT HAPPY.

In a city not really known for its Chinese food, Emperor's Choice continues to offer very nice food at moderate prices. Smallish and longish restaurant with the proverbial fish tank when you walk in the dining room, there are but 10-15 tables in this little establishment located right in the middle of Chicago's Chinatown. Generally don't have to wait for a table because they turn them pretty well. My fav is still the chicken fried rice, but the egg foo young, and the sweet & sour dishes are nice. Fried meats - like sweet & sour chicken - sometimes have a bit too much breading, but the taste is still there. Biggest problem you'll have here is finding a parking place.

Went here for dim sum with my family. As im chinese, i Ordered my usual dimsum stuff such as siumai, ha kao, chicken feet, BBQ pork bun, salted egg yolk bun, and also ordered beef w veggie and spicy eggplant to share as our main.  Everything was good, except.... the BBQ pork bun's filling is a bit dry; salted egg yolk bun's filling can be a bit smoother. But overall Im very happy that I have a place to go for dimsum now, especially with the fact that there's no authentic Chinese food around my area(streeterville) And I have to travel each time by car in order to get my Asian food.

We have been going here for at least 15 years and it is the very best there is.  Old school chinese and always fresh.  The help is wonderful, especially our favorite waitress Helen. Order the salt and pepper fish, outstanding...........
Pretty darn good! Good service nice drinks! I just wish they were open for us late nighter!
excellent empires beef dinner, egg roll was ok, will I come back definitely.

came here during the Chinese New Year Parade.  I'm extremely limited on what I can eat due to allergies and the restaurant worked with me.  What they prepared for me was very good and they even made sure that I wasn't allergic to the gravy!  Would definitely go again

First and foremost, this restaurant is NOT on the second floor.  It is the place with the green awning (like in the photo), in the old part of Chinatown on ground level.  I love Emperor's Choice and have been eating there for over 15 years now.  They are really known for their seafood.  The salt & pepper soft shell crab is amazing.  One of my favorite dishes ever.  Go during soft shell crab season in May and they will be even better.  The peking style dungeness crab is also delicious.  Messy, but totally worth it.

Great date place. This place is located on the second floor of the building. Fantastic service. They are quick to refill drinks and remove plates without interrupting your meal. We had drinks (Long Island and a Volcano sized Blue Hawaii) Drinks were actually tasty. We had the dinner for two. BBQ Pork Eggrolls Egg Drop Soup Chicken Chow Mein Fried Rice Sweet and Sour Chicken Plus Shrimp Toast & Crab Rangoon. Dinner ended with fortune cookies and almond cookies. Candles were placed on the table when we arrived and water was served promptly. Bike parking out front. Steps from the Red Line.

I have never eaten in any Chinatown in US- NY, SF but Emperor's choice in Chicago's mini Chinatown is great. Its quite a small restaurant and not a lot of tables. It does not look like a high end restaurant and thats a positive sign about a chinese restaturant as far as I am concerned.  The food- We ordered three things - Hunan Shrimp, Chicken Noodles and Double cooked Pork. The shrimp and pork were ordered extra spicy. The quantity was more like for 3 people and we were just two and still managed to finish 90% of the food. It was amazing. The dry noodles can be ordered either thin or fat. The waitrees suggested thin so thin it was. It is easily the best noodles I have eaten and I have eaten them in Asia too. The noodles were cooked perfectly. Actually I could eat them with some chilli sauce and nothing else. The chicken in the noodles was very very tasty. It was a masterpiece. The Pork was the other great dish and I am glad my wife ordered the double cooked pork extra spicy. It just great. If you like pork you will like this. It was spicy, pork were chewy and juicy and the sauces were perfect. The hunan shrimp was not great and and if I had ordered the shrimp and noodles, wud have given 3-4 stars. But the noodles and pork were so so good that I feel like giving it a ten. Next time I visit Chicago, I am going here again.

Well it's Mothers Day weekend and Maria has a taste for some good Won Ton soup.  Especially since our old favorite of the Rising Sun has gone way down hill with their Won Ton soup lately.  I hope you are reading this owners of the Rising Sun.  So we pack up the van, Maria, I and the three younger kids and we start heading north.  My wife is thinking Chinatown might be a good spot for her Mothers Day meal and to quench her hunger for some good Won Ton soup. It's a cool and rainy Saturday, so Lincoln Park zoo is a NO from our guest of honor.  We have called our oldest daughter and have told her to meet us by the Fire Station in Chinatown.  After everyone arrives we do some typical tourist sight seeing.  We always stop in the Hoypoloi, it's an uncommon gallery you know.  Then we say let's pick a place to eat.  It's Maria's call and she is trying to remember the place we ate at in the past that had really good Won Ton soup.  We finally remember and find it, the Emperor's Choice. Maria and I start by ordering a bowl each of the Won Ton soup.  Afterward Maria and I both say the same thing, it was good but not like the last time we had it.  It was a bit on the watery side but at least the dumplings were hot and tasty.  We also started with the Emperor's Egg Rolls and the Pot Stickers.  I am usually the only one who just loves Egg Rolls but even Maria thought they were truly outstanding this time.  The Pot Stickers were also good, not outstanding, but good. For our main course items we ordered the Mongolian Beef (which was just average), the Beef with Broccoli (which had some of the best tasting beef I have had in a while.  It seemed like they used a better cut of meat which was real GOOD), the Pork Fried Rice (just average, a little burnt tasting), the Emperor's Shredded Chicken (which we all agreed was truly BAD I'm sorry to say Emperors.  It was the only left over dish we refused to take home with us.  The chicken or the sauce, something just truly tasted off.  No one got sick but we thought it was really bad) and finally the Shrimp with Cashews (which had bland tasting shrimp, even though they were huge pieces of shrimp and bland tasting cashews). So in general we received fast and friendly service.  The food was average this time around.  The price with all the food, drinks and tip was roughly $110 dollars.  And the most important part, did Maria enjoy her Mother's Day 2011 meal, she said, "Yes, I liked it."

Emperor's Choice offers the very best versions of your standard dishes found at Chinese restaurants everywhere.  Think Kung Pao Chicken, Beef and Broccoli, hot and sour soup, etc.  For this reason, Emperor's Choice is very popular with non-Chinese people.  Picky and/or unadventurous diners (or members of their parties) can rest assured that they will find expertly prepared versions of their favorite Chinese dishes.

Fast service and excellent dim sum.  I went after work on a Friday, about 6:00 and the place was pretty empty.  They could have used a bit more selection on the menu, but all in all I walked away very satisfied.  They have a scenic 2nd floor view of the Chinatown streetscape too.  I imagine this is a great place to watch the Chicago Marathon, from the window-side tables.

The room was comfortable in an old-fashioned kind of way, our server was friendly, the food was prepared in record time and in great quantity.   Unfortunately the food was bland, uninspired, and cooked until everything - from the chop suey, to the bean curd cakes, to the bbq beef - all shared an unappetizingly limp texture.  Our party found all the offerings (except the white rice) virtually inedible and sadly left most of it on the plates.     On my next trip to Chinatown, I will definitely not be returning to Emperor's Choice.

Chicago's Chinatown is one of the best culinary assets of our city. If you have never been, please do so even if just to walk the streets. I've enjoyed regular family dinners in Chinatown ever since I can remember. There are two places we always visited, Emperor's Choice and The Phoenix. Since it had been an unusually long time between Chinatown visits, we made Emperor's Choice the destination for dinner with Erica and her her mother Jean. I could end the review now and simply say if you want great Chinese food go to Chinatown and enjoy. We all have our favorite spots and our favorite dishes, but now you can see mine. Ask my friends and you'll hear that each meal with me must start with pot-stickers, the doughy dumpling filled with pork (or chicken or veggies depending on location). I have always loved the pot-stickers at EC, and especially love the dipping sauce. I prefer mine steamed, some choose pan fried. Since there were only three of us, we limited our ordering to three dishes (with healthy leftovers). My family Chinese dinners normally involved a serious dose of over-ordering because we love our Chinese food. The staples at EC are schezwan string beans and kung pao chicken, and then any other dishes that spark interest. That night we ordered a tasty and healthy scallop and vegetable dish. The string beans are one of my all time favorites, especially from EC. They were on the spicy side this time, unfortunate for Erica, but I loved them. Kung Pao Chicken is also a go-to, and they did not disappoint with little pieces of chicken in a moderately spicy peanut kung pao sauce. There are lots of vegetables too. Our scallop dish was the nice complement to all the other flavors. It was a flavorful but subtle garlic sauce, scallops and steamed veggies. Everything was great, especially the next day at home. If you want delicious and authentic (Americanized) Chinese food, head to Chinatown and look up Emperor's Choice. It's nice to order from your local delivery guy, but every once in a while it's worth the trip for the best.

1) How is this place Zagat rated?!?  2) How can you screw up cashew chicken?  3) What kind of Chinese restaurant charges for tea and doesn't serve oranges (or at least some kind of fruit) at the end? PS- The roast duck was dry/overcooked. Would've given this 0 stars if I could.
My family takes a trip to Chicago every year and we always eat at the Emperor's Choice.  The food is great as well as the service.

absolutly am in love with this place.they know me when i walk in the door so that shows you how much i am in the joint.i recomend general tso's chicken, youll never eat it anywhere else again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

In general, I feel like Chicago is definitely not known for it's plethora of good chinese food.
